com.yahoo.bullet.storage

Class StorageManager<V extends Serializable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yahoo.bullet.storage.StorageManager<V>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - The type of the Serializable data stored in the underlying storage. Encapsulates the concept of a Storage. It can abstract away a key-value storage as well as other ways of storing data. It uses three main concepts (see below) - namespaces, partitions and criteria to abstract away most storages. It lets you store and retrieve raw byte[] or strings, or objects of the type parameter. It exposes these concepts:
    1. The concept of a namespace. This can be used to abstract different concepts like tables if the storage is relational or multiple conceptual storages.
    2. The concept of a partition. It is up to the concrete implementation to choose to shard its data if needed and understand how to access its shards given the keys. A partition is defined at each namespace level. If you need partitions for your storage, override the partition specific methods - getPartition(String, int), clear(String, int), numberOfPartitions(String) and repartition(String, int), as well as actually partitioning the data when implementing the byte[] methods. For convenience, a hash(String, int) is provided. By default, unless the specific storage manager says so, the storage is assumed to be unpartitioned.
    3. The concept of a criteria. A criteria is a general query. A specific StorageManager can provide storage-specific Criteria for storage-specific querying needs. Note that the Criteria methods, retrieveAll(Criteria) and getAll(Criteria) do not take a namespace since those are handled by the Criteria implementations. The apply(Criteria, Object) can be used as a general method to apply arbitrary changes to the storage.
    Implementors of this class should implement the various raw byte[] methods - the accessors - as well as the clear and wipe methods. To change the default conversion to and from the type of the StorageManager and the byte[], you can override the convert(Serializable) and convert(byte[]) methods. For convenience,
    1. All the accessors are provided with their String variants to store and retrieve values as Strings in addition to the type of data stored in the storage. If you wish to control how the encoding happens, you may override toString(byte[]) and toBytes(String). The map flavors are available as toByteArrayMap(Map) and toStringMap(Map) methods.
    2. All the accessors (including the ones in 1. above) are provided without requiring a namespace. These methods use the DEFAULT_NAMESPACE when invoking the corresponding methods that do require a namespace. If you wish to control the default namespace used, override the getDefaultNamespace() method.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MemoryStorageManager, MultiMemoryStorageManager, NullStorageManager

    public abstract class StorageManager<V extends Serializable>
extends Object
implements Serializable
    See Also:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • numberOfPartitions

        public int numberOfPartitions()
        Returns the number of partitions stored in this storage manager for the default namespace. Partitions can be sharded in storage and can also be used as a smaller unit of processing to reduce memory requirements. Partitions are numbered with integers from 0 inclusive to numberOfPartitions() exclusive for the namespace. By default, the storage manager is unpartitioned.
        Returns:
        The number of partitions in this storage manager.

      • getPartition

        public CompletableFuture<Map<String,V>> getPartition(int partition)
        Retrieves the IDs stored in the provided partition for the default namespace.
        Parameters:
        partition - The partition number to return.
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture that resolves to a Map of IDs to their stored values as byte arrays or null if no data is present.

      • repartition

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture that resolves to true if the repartitioning was successful.

      • hash

        public static int hash(String key,
                       int numberOfPartitions)
        A default hash function for a given String that places the String into 0 to numberOfPartitions exclusive. Note that numberOfPartitions must be a whole number.
        Parameters:
        key - The String key to hash.
        numberOfPartitions - The number of partitions. Must be zero or positive.
        Returns:
        An integer from 0 to numberOfPartitions.

        . By default, close does nothing. If the particular storage needs to release resources, this is the place to do it.

      • getAllRaw

        protected CompletableFuture<Map<String,byte[]>> getAllRaw(String namespace,
                                                          Set<String> ids)
        Retrieves the values for the provided IDs from the given namespace in the storage as byte[]. By default, calls getRaw(String, String) repeatedly on each of the given IDs in parallel.
        Parameters:
        namespace - The namespace of the IDs.
        ids - The Set of IDs to retrieve.
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture that resolves to a Map of IDs to their stored values as byte[].

      • wipe

        public abstract CompletableFuture<Boolean> wipe()

        namespace - The namespace to store this value under.
        id - The ID to store this value under.
        value - The object to store as the value.
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture that resolves to true if the store succeeded.

      • get

        public CompletableFuture<V> get(String namespace,
                                String id)
        Retrieves data stored for a given String identifier in the given namespace as a Serializable object.
        Parameters:
        namespace - The namespace of the data.
        id - The ID of the data.
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture that resolves to the data.

      • putAll

        public CompletableFuture<Boolean> putAll(String namespace,
                                         Map<String,V> data)
        Stores a map of IDs and values into the storage in the given namespace.
        Parameters:
        namespace - The namespace to store the entries in.
        data - The map of IDs and values to store.
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture that resolves to true if the storage was completely successful.

      • getAll

        public CompletableFuture<Map<String,V>> getAll(String namespace)
        Retrieves all the IDs from the given namespace in the storage as a Map of IDs to their Serializable values.
        Parameters:
        namespace - The namespace to retrieve from.
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture that resolves to a Map of IDs to their stored values.

      • getAll

        public CompletableFuture<Map<String,V>> getAll(String namespace,
                                               Set<String> ids)
        Retrieves the values for the provided IDs from the given namespace in the storage as a Map of IDs to their Serializable values.
        Parameters:
        namespace - The namespace of the IDs.
        ids - The Set of IDs to retrieve.
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture that resolves to a Map of IDs to their stored values.

      • remove

        public CompletableFuture<V> remove(String namespace,
                                   String id)
        Retrieves and removes data stored for a given String identifier as a Serializable object in the given namespace.
        Parameters:
        namespace - The namespace of the data.
        id - The ID of the data.
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture that resolves to the data.

      • numberOfPartitions

        public int numberOfPartitions(String namespace)
        Returns the number of partitions stored in this storage manager for the given namespace. Partitions can be sharded in storage and can also be used as a smaller unit of processing to reduce memory requirements. Partitions are numbered with integers from 0 inclusive to numberOfPartitions(String) exclusive for the namespace. By default, if the storage manager is unpartitioned, this returns 0.
        Parameters:
        namespace - The namespace whose partitions are being asked for.
        Returns:
        The number of partitions in this storage manager.

      • getPartitionRaw

        protected CompletableFuture<Map<String,byte[]>> getPartitionRaw(String namespace,
                                                                int partition)
        Retrieves the IDs stored in the provided partition for the given namespace. By default, if the storage manager is unpartitioned, this works the same as getAllRaw(String)
        Parameters:
        namespace - The namespace to retrieve the IDs from.
        partition - The partition number to return.
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture that resolves to a Map of IDs to their stored values as byte arrays or null if no data is present.

      • getPartition

        public CompletableFuture<Map<String,V>> getPartition(String namespace,
                                                     int partition)
        Retrieves the IDs stored in the provided partition for the given namespace. By default, if the storage manager is unpartitioned, this works the same as getAll(String)
        Parameters:
        namespace - The namespace to retrieve the IDs from.
        partition - The partition number to return.
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture that resolves to a Map of IDs to their stored values as Serializable objects or null if no data is present.

      • clear

        public CompletableFuture<Boolean> clear(String namespace,
                                        int partition)
        Clears the specified partition under the given namespace.
        Parameters:
        namespace - The namespace for the partition.
        partition - The partition to clear.
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture that resolves to true if the wipe was successful.

      • repartition

        public CompletableFuture<Boolean> repartition(String namespace,
                                              int newPartitionCount)
        Repartitions the data into the given new number of partitions for the given namespace. If the storage manager is unpartitioned, this does nothing.
        Parameters:
        namespace - The namespace to repartition.
        newPartitionCount - The new number of partitions to use.
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture that resolves to true if the repartitioning was successful.

      • convert

        protected V convert(byte[] bytes)
        Converts a @byte[] to a type of the given object. By default, uses SerializerDeserializer to deserialize using Java deserialization.
        Parameters:
        bytes - The byte[] to convert.
        Returns:
        The converted object or null if the input was null or the conversion was unable to be performed.

      • convert

        protected byte[] convert(V object)
        Converts an object of the given type to a @byte[]. By default, uses SerializerDeserializer to serialize using Java serialization.
        Parameters:
        object - The object to convert.
        Returns:
        The converted byte[] or null if the input was null or the conversion was unable to be performed.

      • fromObjectMap

        public static <S> Map<String,byte[]> fromObjectMap(Map<String,S> input,
                                                   Function<S,byte[]> converter)
        Converts a Map of String and the given type to a Map of String to byte[].
        Type Parameters:
        S - The type to convert from.
        Parameters:
        input - The String to the given type map.
        converter - The Function that converts from the given type to byte[].
        Returns:
        The String to byte[] converted map.

      • toObjectMap

        public static <S> Map<String,S> toObjectMap(Map<String,byte[]> input,
                                            Function<byte[],S> converter)
        Converts a Map of String to byte[] to a Map of String to the given type.
        Type Parameters:
        S - The type to convert to.
        Parameters:
        input - The String to byte[] map.
        converter - The Function that converts from byte[] to the given type.
        Returns:
        The String to the given type converted map.
